Message.Title: Google losing its Battle with VRNG in Court:
Message.Msg: Vringo: Day 3 In Court With Video Deposition And Expert Testimony ******************** Summary of events for October 18th Vringo/ i/P Engine vs Google ******************** This was an event filled day for Vringo. However, before I proceed I need to caution you all to take your own independent decisions and not based on my reports. Let me thank all the contributors (James Altucher, Steve Kim, John Ford and all other in Message Boards –too many to name all) who have brought us all to speed so far. I am sure we will need their support and guidance to lead us through the dark tunnel. Without further delay here’s the scoop: ******************** ******************** 10:45 AM -Video Deposition #1: Google Sr. Product Manager – Jon Diorio (totally confused deposition) *************************** Jon is Sr. Product Marketing manager at Google for Adwords( I believe). He was questioned about the documentation which shows Adwords using the process mentioned in Lang’s patents (customer facing documents). As we know that product management/marketing are more of customer facing side of business, they have to ensure that details are not mis-leading to customers. The video deposition aimed to understand whether he agreed with the current material and does he see any inaccuracies. Basically, he agrees that the document is not inaccurate but at the same time he also refuses to claim that it is accurate. In a way, he was contradicting throughout and the way he was communicating in the video, it may convey that he is possibly evading giving right answers(potentially trained/ coached by legal team to deny anything specific) or he knows something is / was fishy and he may not want to admit it. Again, who in right mind would damn their own employer? / Also, he was asked about review process of documentation and he mentioned that several teams from Google would be involved such as sales, marketing and his team. So, he seemed to imply that there are multiple levels of reviews done. What matters most? Perception of this deposition….Here are my personal ratings…. Coherence- 4/1o Consistency – 4/10 Contradictions – 8/10 (i.e high contradictions to similar questions asked after few intervals in different language) Admission of infringement – No – obviously… Knowledge of Lang’s patents – No Overall, he seemed pretty nervous and was not conveying right body language. I don’t know if court can actually have someone take lie detector tests. ******************************** 11:15 AM-Video Deposition #2: Gary Holt – Google Software Engineer working on Adwords (evasive and possibly demonstrating his lack of knowledge) ******************** This I believe was the longest deposition. As a software engineer, one is more concerned with system level documentation. He was specifically asked about “Quality Score” and he answered that there are multiple versions of the same. However, we have to wait for tomorrow when propriety code is checked by Dr. Frieder. There was a lot of discussion of when “SmartAds” was adopted and the associated revenue increase. He admitted hearing at least 20% bump in revenues due to “SmartAds” being employed although he himself did not verify through any experiments. I believe Gary Holt will also be counter-questioned in court sometime next week in person. In video deposition, you may get away with evasive answers or denial but I don’t know if taking oath and facing court pumps you to be more forthcoming. We will have to wait and see. Overall personal ratings: Coherence- 6/1o Consistency –6/10 Contradictions – 6/10 (i.e high contradictions to similar questions asked after few intervals in different language) Admission of infringement – No – obviously… Knowledge of Lang’s patents – No Note: Ratings reflect good job done by Vringo team in asking right questions. Sometimes, asking questions repeatedly can actually change answers….saw that live today. ****************************** Video Deposition #3: Bartholomew Furrow – Google Software Engineer working on Adwords ( evasive and no clue again) ******************** The discussion was essentially around architecture of smartass. I.e servers, filtering, ranking, pctr , qbb, I happened to miss this a bit. But this was pretty much on lines of Gary’s deposition. Overall , I felt Barth was more forthcoming in terms of laying out the complete infrastructure of adwords. ********************!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!******************** 2:30 PM – Dr. Frieder Testimony: An introduction to one of the respected academician, practitioner and researcher in the area of “Search, Relevancy, Parallel processing of search etc” Background: University of Michigan, Phd….(started to get involved in search in 1985) Fellow (top 1%) of ACM – Associate of Computer Machinary Fellow (top 1%) of IEEE – You find out Endowed Professor (amongst the only 4 in Georgetown) – Highest designation as a Professor**** Department Chair – Computer Science Dept – for undergrads, Master, PHD Industry Contributions on Search – Developed Search model which is used by Harris Corporation for Defence projects He has been awarded lot of awards from various organizations that you would be able to find out from his profile. Current research interests include bio-search or bio-informatics …in short, searching for specific information on drugs feedback via social network, comments, and research documentation and pulling them together. Overall, a hard core computer science genius as far as background and knowledge is concerned. ******************** Dr. Frieder’s Testimony: ******************** Basically, he laid out the process of providing relevant ad associated with search query i.e your information need. Step 1: Query Step 2: Content based matching – i.e Finding the text in the Ads in the server (some rating say 6/10) Step 2A: Collaborative: How many the ads in the past have been clicked (i.e repeated feedback from users (let’s say the score is 8/10) Step 3: Quality Score: This is the most crucial step. The ad should be relevant content-wise(i.e step 2) and must have also been clicked before as being relevant – context wise i.e users have demonstrated by clicking it. Then Quality Score is simplest terms can be Content Based Score + Collaborative Score / Average = Quality Score Dr. Frieder explicity mentions that Collaborative techniques have been mentioned in Lang’s patents. Again, I am not a patent expert here. I am just reporting as I see it. As per Google documentation, they have been using Step 2A onwards which is an infringement of Lang’s patents. He demonstrated the entire process in an animated and color coded version of patents and showed exactly how Goog infringed. Remember – Yellow – Search Query / Results Blue Color- Content Relevancy Green – Collaborative Combination of Green and Blue gives – Let’s just say purple for now i.e Quality Score , which is then filtered and displayed back to yellow (search results). Why am I mentioning this in colors? Well, Jury can absorb this much easily and so can I when I am sitting there for hours without my 3 cups of daily coffee….You get the point I hope. ********************************************** Dr. Frieder’s Testimony on Claims: – This is we we go blind and follow Dr. Frieder. *********************************************** Dr. Frieder went through his process of claims. Basically he ticked everything from search- preamble, targeting, collaboration-content, quality score, filtering… Basically summarizing that it was infringed end to end- excluding google search which is preamble…. Given all the details we worked out in the afternoon, we certainly couldn’t get through this one. More details will be followed-up on Dr. Frieder’s claims. This is the most interesting part. ********************************** Trial Roadmap – Percy View ******************** I see that Vringo is in full strength and it shows that they are damn serious about this. I do see CEO, Ken Lang, Kosak, and Don sitting through-out the day. However, as far as Google is concerned, I’m afraid that they are taking this a bit lightly. None of the senior executives (at least – VP level’s ) are present…based on my recollection of their hierarchy. My prediction is that Google may possibly be on the path of danger. Probability of Winning: Vringo – 65% Google – 35% This is based on today’s events. Imagine the effect on stock price if Google loses trail…!!!!!! Unless, this comes in mainstream media, I see little hope in buzz being created. Again, that’s what we hope we all can do in our small way !!!! *************

These products are initially aimed at the growing gaming industry but could be extrapolated to complex engineering simulation programs and other applications requiring super fast processing speeks DRAM could be a multi-bagger from here and it currently has no downside at today's rock-bottom prices Today 10/18/2012 DRAM news: Dataram to Attend AMD Radeon™ ExtravaLANza Wed, Oct 17, 2012 12:30 PM EDT PRINCETON, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Dataram Corporation (DRAM), a leading international manufacturer of computer memory, storage and software products, is proud to announce its participation at the AMD inaugural Radeon™ ExtravaLANza event on October 20, 2012 in support of the launch of AMD Radeon™ RAMDisk. The company recently announced a formal agreement with AMD to develop an AMD-branded version of its Dataram RAMDisk™, marketing the product under the name Radeon™ RAMDisk and offering gaming enthusiasts the ability to improve load times for a substantially enhanced gaming experience. Dataram representatives will be demonstrating the performance of Radeon™ RAMDisk and interacting directly with end users to answer questions and dialog about their experience with the product. Dataram will also be giving away free Radeon™ RAMDisk licenses to those end users who demonstrate the highest-performing and most creative uses of the product. The event, taking place in Markham, ON, Canada from Noon to 6:00 PM, is an opportunity to visit AMD’s Canadian headquarters and talk to some of AMD's leading global hardware and software partners. New technologies will be showcased and attendees will have an opportunity to win some great prizes. About Dataram Founded in 1967, Dataram is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of high-quality computer memory, storage and software products. Our products and services deliver IT infrastructure optimization, dramatically increase application performance and deliver substantial cost savings. Dataram solutions are deployed in 70 Fortune 100 companies and in mission-critical government and defense applications around the world. About AMD AMD (AMD) is a semiconductor design innovator leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its groundbreaking AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs) that power a wide range of computing devices. AMD’s server computing products are focused on driving industry-leading cloud computing and virtualization environments. AMD’s superior graphics technologies are found in a variety of solutions ranging from game consoles, PCs to supercomputers

Message.Msg: DRAM Announced yetterday the Kick-off of its Partnership with AMD for Making AMD’s Superfast Radeon RAMDisks . AMD’s Radeon Extravaganza Event will be held on October 20, 2012. DRAM will make the AMD’s Radeon RAMDisks targeting gaming enthusiasts initially. Other applications requiring superfast processing will be announced later. This is a HUGE deal for tiny DRAM 12- month target: $3++…….Sleepy Multi-bagger in the making DRAM with only 5M share float and $6 million market cap is super-undervalued trading at a 0.15 X Sales. The company was almost break-even before this gigantic news for tiny DRAM. The company has a strong balance sheet and ZERO debt. The new Radeon products will increase processing speeds by over 500% vs. conventional products. These products are initially aimed at the growing gaming industry but could be extrapolated to complex engineering simulation programs and other applications requiring super fast processing speeks DRAM could be a multi-bagger from here and it currently has no downside at today's rock-bottom prices ....DRAM NEWS Dataram to Attend AMD Radeon™ ExtravaLANza Wed, Oct 17, 2012 12:30 PM EDT PRINCETON, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Dataram Corporation (DRAM), a leading international manufacturer of computer memory, storage and software products, is proud to announce its participation at the AMD inaugural Radeon™ ExtravaLANza event on October 20, 2012 in support of the launch of AMD Radeon™ RAMDisk. The company recently announced a formal agreement with AMD to develop an AMD-branded version of its Dataram RAMDisk™, marketing the product under the name Radeon™ RAMDisk and offering gaming enthusiasts the ability to improve load times for a substantially enhanced gaming experience. Dataram representatives will be demonstrating the performance of Radeon™ RAMDisk and interacting directly with end users to answer questions and dialog about their experience with the product. Dataram will also be giving away free Radeon™ RAMDisk licenses to those end users who demonstrate the highest-performing and most creative uses of the product. The event, taking place in Markham, ON, Canada from Noon to 6:00 PM, is an opportunity to visit AMD’s Canadian headquarters and talk to some of AMD's leading global hardware and software partners. New technologies will be showcased and attendees will have an opportunity to win some great prizes. About Dataram Founded in 1967, Dataram is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of high-quality computer memory, storage and software products. Our products and services deliver IT infrastructure optimization, dramatically increase application performance and deliver substantial cost savings. Dataram solutions are deployed in 70 Fortune 100 companies and in mission-critical government and defense applications around the world. About AMD AMD (AMD) is a semiconductor design innovator leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its groundbreaking AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs) that power a wide range of computing devices. AMD’s server computing products are focused on driving industry-leading cloud computing and virtualization environments. AMD’s superior graphics technologies are found in a variety of solutions ranging from game consoles, PCs to supercomputers

I believe that he appeared to be visibly evasive when asked sensitive questions. In my notes, I wrote: "You could feel this guy stress and squirm at key points!" I also believe that despite the appearance of trying to stretch the truth for Google, he essentially admitted that AdWords uses "Content-Based Filtering." I also believe that he looked ridiculous when he tried to Claim that the "pCTR" (predictive Click-Through Rate) was not a "Rating." He said that a Rating could be on a scale of 1 to 10, but he would not concede that the Zero-to-One probabilities generated by SmartAds that AdWords uses to rank ads is a form of Rating system. Despite his insistence, he appeared to not be able to find any logic to justify his opinion! After Lunch (2:20 PM ET on Thursday, October 18th), Dr. Frieder took the stand as a live witness. He is I/P Engine's Expert Witness on Infringement. I believe that so far he has done a very convincing job of showing the Jury that Google's AdWords practices each and every element and limitation of Claim 10 in Vringo's '420 Patent. He had a chart with the words of Claim 10 broken down into its individual elements, and he had I/P Engine's attorney "check-the-box" as he demonstrated how Google practices each and every element. He also did this by showing the Jury actual Google Documents describing the functionality.'

Topic.Title: 1049 Democrat Ladies 802 Changed Sides Voting For Romney, 247 for Obama - A Focus Group

Message.Msg: A senior Romney campaign staffer talking to Power Play about the strategy for the closing weeks of the campaign. Two weeks ago, Mitt Romney trailed in five Rust Belt battleground states by an average of 6.9 points in the Real Clear Politics Average of polls. This morning, his average deficit was just 3.2 points. While all 11 swing states have moved his direction since the Republican nominee’s boffo performance in his first debate with President Obama, Romney has seen the most significant improvement in the core column of the swing states: Pennsylvania, Ohio, Michigan, Wisconsin and Iowa. Power Play readers have long known that the 2012 election would come down to the nation’s industrial heartland. Yes, Florida, Virginia and North Carolina are crucial for Romney. And certainly the president needs to hold on to his Western firewall in Colorado, Nevada and New Mexico. But this election, like most in recent memory, was always going to be about how those folks in the I-70 corridor and surrounding areas would vote. With 70 electoral votes up for grabs – votes that Obama swept in 2008 – the battleground stretching between Allentown, Pa. and Sioux City, Iowa has been the main front in this political war.

Message.Title: Here's Why Google Could Disappear in Five Years: Pro ---- CNBC full article...
Message.Msg: Google may be on its way out as the dominant player in search, according to one analyst — and could even "disappear" in as little as five to eight years if the competitive pressures that ultimately claimed other search giants start to take root. In the wake of a surprisingly weak earnings report, Eric Jackson, Ironfire capital founder and managing member, said Google Google [GOOG 681.79 -13.21 (-1.9%) ] could easily find itself fending off the woes that eventually took hold at embattled Yahoo! [YHOO 15.84 -0.16 (-1%) ]. "They could disappear in five to eight years and disappear in the sense that Yahoo used to be the king of search. Now, for all intents and purposes, Yahoo has disappeared," Jackson said Thursday on CNBC's "Squawk on the Street". The primary reason Google may lose its search dominance is because the company is facing the same mobile problem as Facebook [FB 19.00 0.025 (+0.13%) ], Jackson said. (Read More: Google Has the Same Mobile-Ad Problem as Facebook) "If Facebook saw a deceleration in their sales and their growth lead to a halving of their stock price...why wouldn't it also be something that is very negative for Google as it continues to play out?" he said. Google reported in its quarterly earnings, which were released Wednesday, that its cost per click (CPC) was down 15 percent in the third quarter. While the company reported that ad sales had increased, it is likely that CPCs will continue to decrease, Jackson said. The reason? Consumers are searching more and more on mobile devices, yet advertisers aren't as willing to buy advertisements formatted for mobile devices, because these ads are not as prominently displayed. Also, mobile ads tend to run more cheaply than ads made for desktop computers. "Obviously, everyone is focusing on CPC...Profitability is way down for five quarters now, for Google, quarter after quarter. Paid clicks, the rate of growth is slowing," Jackson said. "We're facing a scenario, where I think in a couple of years, we might hit peak search." The rise of mobile will lead consumers to want to search in new ways, which may open the door for others to enter the search space. The number one contender may just be Apple [AAPL 609.84 -22.80 (-3.6%) ] — one of Google's fiercest competitors, he said. "I think that there is a big opportunity right now for someone to step forward and assert themselves for a new way of getting people information for doing search in a mobile world," Jackson said. "I don't think typing in a blue box is the ideal format for a mobile world. And I think the best opportunity out there to displace Google in this area is probably Apple's Siri." However, Google could still turn things around, and the company is doing some things to make up for the decline in CPC. Google shopping, for example, has been changed to only show paid results in a way that should generate a lot of money for the company, Jackson said. This too, however, could pose a new problem for the search giant. "The question is, is that move going to degrade the service, is that sort of the tip of the iceberg?" he said. "And are we going to start to see paid search results in other areas of Google and is that going to degrade the experience?"
